prompt.name: Search for a Specific Article
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User searches for a specific article from the main portal and verifies the resulting page title. This tests the most fundamental feature of the site.

input.action: 'In the search input field, type `Python (programming language)`', 'Click the search button with the arrow icon', 'Click on Dark Mode'

expected.outcome: The article page for 'Python (programming language)' is displayed, with the correct heading.

prompt.name: Change Language from Portal Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User changes the Wikipedia language edition by clicking a direct language link on the main portal page.

input.action: 'Click the `Español` link under the 'Read Wikipedia in your language' section', 'Select Grande from Texto', 'Select Ancho

expected.outcome: The user is successfully redirected to the Spanish Wikipedia main page.

prompt.name: Navigate to a Random Article
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User uses the 'Random article' feature from the main menu to discover a new page. This tests a key navigation and discovery tool.

input.action: 'Click the `Main menu` (hamburger icon) on the top left', 'Click the `Random article` link from the menu', 'Click on hambuerger icon', 'CLick on Current events'

expected.outcome: A random Wikipedia article is loaded, and the URL is different from the Main Page's URL.

prompt.name: Change Language to Japanese
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User changes the Wikipedia language from the main portal by clicking the direct link for Japanese.

input.action: 'Click the `日本語` link under the 'Read Wikipedia in your language' section'

expected.outcome: The user is successfully redirected to the Japanese Wikipedia main page.

prompt.name: Navigate to Today's Featured Article
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates from the English Main Page to view the full content of the day's featured article.

input.action: 'click on English language', 'locate the `From today's featured article` section', 'Click on the main bolded link for the article's title'

expected.outcome: The full page for the featured article is displayed.

prompt.name: Toggle Dark Mode
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User enables the 'Dark mode' appearance setting on an article page.

input.action: 'input cat in search bar', 'Click search', 'switch to dark mode from sidebar'

expected.outcome: The page was successfully switched to dark mode.

prompt.name: Navigate to 'On This Day'
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User explores a historical event listed in the 'On this day...' section of the Main Page.

input.action: 'On the Main Page, locate the `On this day...` section', 'Click on any bolded link for a historical event', 'Locate See Also','Click on the first link in the See Also section'

expected.outcome: The article page for the selected historical event is displayed.

prompt.name: Use Table of Contents to Navigate
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User clicks a link in the article's 'Contents' box to jump to a specific section on the page.

input.action: 'On the article page, find the `Contents` box near the top', 'Click the link for the `Government and politics` section'

expected.outcome: The viewport successfully jumps to the selected section of the article.

prompt.name: Toggle Table of Contents Visibility
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User clicks a link in the article's 'Contents' box to jump to a specific section on the page.

input.action: 'On the article page, find the `Contents` box near the top', 'Click the hide button to hide contents', 'Click on the hamburger icon with three dots','Click on move to sidebar

expected.outcome: The Table of Contents is restored in the sidebar.

prompt.name: Navigate to 'Current Events'
prompt.instruction: go to https://wikipedia.org/and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'Current events' portal from the main menu.

input.action: 'Click on English language', 'Click the `Main menu` (hamburger icon) on the top left', 'Click the `Current events` link from the menu'

expected.outcome: The Current Events portal page is displayed.

prompt.name: View a 'Talk' Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Science and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates from an article to its associated 'Talk' page where discussions about the article take place.

input.action: 'On the article page, click the `Talk` tab at the very top of the page', 'Click on final version of the article'

expected.outcome: The final version of the 'Talk:Science' page is displayed, showing discussions and edits related to the article.

prompt.name: Change Text Appearance
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User changes the text size and width using the appearance settings.

input.action: 'Click the settings icon (looks like a cog or 'Aa') in the top sticky header', 'Under `Text size`, click `Large`', 'Under `Width`, click `Wide`','Click on `hide` beside `Contents`','Click on three dots besides `Moon` title to open Table of COntents','Click on move to sidebar to restore appearance'

expected.outcome: The article's text size changes to large, the width changes to wide, and the Table of Contents is restored to the sidebar.

prompt.name: Navigate to 'What Links Here'
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gold and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User finds the tool that lists all other Wikipedia pages linking to the current article.

input.action: 'Open the `Tools` dropdown menu', 'Click on `What links here`', 'Go back to the article page

expected.outcome: Gold article page is displayed

prompt.name: Download pdf version of an Article
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the simplified, printable version of an article.

input.action: 'Open the `Tools` dropdown menu', 'Click on `Download as pdf`','Click on Download'

expected.outcome: A simplified, printer-friendly version of the 'Water' article is displayed.

prompt.name: Go to the 'About Wikipedia' Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates from the main menu to learn more about the Wikipedia project itself.

input.action: 'Click the `Main menu` (hamburger icon) on the top left', 'Click the `About Wikipedia` link from the menu'

expected.outcome: The 'About Wikipedia' information page is displayed.

prompt.name: Use Search Autocomplete
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User types in the search bar and clicks on a suggested article from the autocomplete dropdown.

input.action: 'In the search input field, type `solar sy`', 'Wait for the search suggestions to appear below the search bar', 'Click the first suggestion, which should be `Solar System`'

expected.outcome: The user successfully navigates to an article by using the search suggestion feature.

prompt.name: View related changes
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gold and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the page that shows recent changes related to the current article.

input.action: 'Click on tools dropdown', 'Click on `Related changes`', 'Enable live updates', 'Disable live updates'

expected.outcome: The user is redirected to the 'Related changes' page, which shows recent edits and changes related to the 'Gold' article.

prompt.name: In-depth Article Navigation and History Check
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user researches a topic by searching for an article, navigating within it using the table of contents, inspecting a citation, and then checking the article's edit history.

input.action: 'Search for `World War II` and navigate to the article', 'In the table of contents, click the `Aftermath` link','In the `Aftermath` section, click on any numbered citation link (e.g., `[315]`)','Scroll to the top and click the `View history` tab','Select oldest revision'

expected.outcome: The user successfully navigates within the article, checks a citation, and views its revision history page.

prompt.name: Advanced Search and File Page Exploration
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user performs an advanced search to find a specific article, then navigates to the page for an image file contained within that article to view its metadata.

input.action: 'Click the search icon without typing anything to navigate to the search page', 'Click the `Advanced search` link', 'In the `Search in page text` section, enter `Oort cloud` into the `These words:` input field', 'Select Image File type', 'Click the `Search` button', 'From the search results, click on the first link for the `Oort cloud` image', 'Click on the metadata tab','Show extended details','Hide extended details'

expected.outcome: User successfully uses advanced search to find an article, then navigates to its main image's file page and confirms the presence of file information.

prompt.name: Category Navigation and Cross-Language Verification
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user explores a topic by navigating through its categories, finds a related article, and then switches to a different language version of that article.

input.action: 'Search for `Albert Einstein` and navigate to the article', 'Scroll to the bottom of the page', ' Click the `20th-century American physicists` link in the categories box', 'On the category page, click the `S` link in the page index to jump to articles starting with 'S'', 'From the list of articles, click on `Alfred Schildn`', 'At the top of the Alfred Schild article, click the `Languages` button', 'In the language selection panel that appears, find and click `Deutsch`', 'Verify the new page URL contains `de.wikipedia.org`'

expected.outcome: The user successfully navigates from one article to another via categories and then views the second article in German.

prompt.name: Navigate via Special Pages to Find Specific Content
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user navigates through Wikipedia's special utility pages to find a specific type of article, demonstrating a deep understanding of the site's structure beyond simple searching.

input.action: 'Click the `Main menu` (hamburger icon) on the top left', 'Click the `Special pages` link', 'On the Special Pages directory, click `All pages with prefix`', 'In the input field next to `Prefix:`, type `List of films`', 'Click the `Show` button', 'From the results, click on a specific list, for example `List of films: A`', 'On that page, click on a link to a film article, such as `A.I. Artificial Intelligence`', 'On the film's article page, click the `Talk` tab at the top'

expected.outcome: The user successfully uses a special page to filter articles, navigates to a specific article from the results, and then views its associated discussion page.

prompt.name: Inspect a Citation's Source via ISBN
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user finds a book-based citation in an article, navigates to the book sources page, and follows an external link to find the book on another website.

input.action: 'Search for `Photosynthesis` and navigate to the article', 'Scroll down to the `Further reading` section', 'Find the first book citation and click the `ISBN` number next to it', 'On the `Book sources` special page, find the `Find this book in a library` section', 'Click the Find this book link for `WorldCat`',  'Go back to the Wikipedia page'

expected.outcome: User successfully follows a citation to the Book Sources page, navigates to an external library site, and returns to wikipedia

prompt.name: Navigate from Wikipedia to Wikimedia Commons
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user inspects an image in an article, navigates to the central Wikimedia Commons repository for that file, and views its version history.

input.action: 'Search for `Mona Lisa` and navigate to the article', 'Click the main image of the Mona Lisa painting to go to the `File:` page','Click on more details', 'On the file page, find the link that says `View on Commons` and click it', 'On the Wikimedia Commons page, scroll down and click the `File history` tab', 'In the file history table, click the timestamp of an older version of the file', 'The page should now display an older version of the image'

expected.outcome: User successfully navigates from a Wikipedia article to the corresponding file page on Wikimedia Commons, inspects older versions, and views the contributor's page.

prompt.name: Follow a Disambiguation Path and Change Language
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user searches for an ambiguous term, chooses the correct article from the disambiguation page, navigates to a related topic, and then switches languages.

input.action: 'Search for `Mercury`', 'On the disambiguation page, click the link for the chemical element: `Mercury (element)`', 'On the article for the element, find the infobox on the right side', 'In the infobox, click the link for its group, `group 12`', 'On the Group 12 page, scroll to the `Applications` section and click a linked application, such as `amalgams`', 'On the Amalgam article, click the `Languages` button at the top', 'In the language selection panel, search for `Français`', 'Click on `Français` to view the French version of the article'

expected.outcome: The user successfully resolves an ambiguity, navigates through several related articles, and views the final article in a different language.

prompt.name: Use 'Related Changes' Tool to Monitor a Topic
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user selects a high-traffic portal and uses the 'Related Changes' tool to monitor recent edits on all pages linked from that portal, then inspects a specific change.

input.action: 'Open the `Tools` dropdown menu', 'Click on `Related changes`', 'Click on gear icon','Set the `Recent days` to `1`', 'From the resulting list of edits, click on a `(diff)` link', 'From the diff view, click the timestamp of the new revision to view that version of the article'

expected.outcome: User successfully uses the 'Related changes' tool to find a recent edit, views the difference, and then views the historical version of the article.

prompt.name: Navigate Portals and Sub-portals
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user explores Wikipedia's content structure by navigating from the main portal directory to a specific sub-portal and then to a featured article within it.

input.action: 'Click the `Main menu` (hamburger icon) and select `Contents`', 'On the `Contents` page, click the `Portals` link', 'On the main portals page, click the `Mathematics and logic` section link', 'Click on ` Arithmetic` link', 'On the Arithmetic portal page, find the `Related portals` section and click on `Mathematics`', 'On the Mathematics portal, Go to `Topics in Mathematics` section', 'Under `Analysis` click on `Calculus`'

expected.outcome: The user successfully navigates to the `Calculus` article.

prompt.name: Explore Page Information and Analytics
prompt.instruction: go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth and perform the following test case
prompt.description: A user navigates to an article's 'Page information' screen to view metadata and then accesses external tools to see detailed analytics about the page's edit history.

input.action: 'Navigate to the `Earth` article page', 'Click the `Main menu` (hamburger icon) on the top left', 'Open the `Tools` dropdown menu and click `Page information`', 'On the `Page information` page, scroll down to the `External tools` section', 'Click the `Pageviews` link to see traffic statistics', 'Navigate back to the previous page', 'Click the `Revision history statistics` link', 'The browser should open a new tab with detailed editing statistics for the article'

expected.outcome: The user successfully finds and views the Page information screen and uses the external tools links to access pageview and revision history analytics.
